description: Borrowed from Latin dēpictus, from dēpingō.

examples: I fond a lyknesse depict upon a wal,
Armed in vertues, as I walk up and doun,
The hed of thre ful solempne and roial,

verbs.description: depict (third-person singular simple present depicts, present participle depicting, simple past and past participle depicted)

entries.meaning: To render a representation of something, using words, sounds, images, or other means. [from early 15th c.]
examples: Synonyms: portray, express, exhibit, register, show, describe, visualise, draw, render, depicture
